title: Conservation of Energy - Block up ramp

content.description: A block, initially at rest on a horizontal track, is compressed against a spring as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The block is released from rest, slides across the horizontal track and then up a curved ramp, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>. Frictional forces are negligible. The block momentarily comes to rest near the top of the ramp. Consider the block, spring, and Earth as a single system.
content.question: Which of the following explains why the block comes to rest while on the ramp?

choices.label: All the mechanical energy in the system has been dissipated.
All the mechanical energy in the system has been transferred into the blockâ€™s motion.
All the mechanical energy in the system has been lost to thermal energy.
All mechanical energy in the system is now in the form of gravitational potential energy

content.answer: All mechanical energy in the system is now in the form of gravitational potential energy
